Sentencas: In order to develop a predictive model of real cell performance, firm relationships and assumptions need to be established for the definition of the physical and microstructure parameters for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Microscale Correlations Adoption in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: This study explores the correlations of microstructure parameters from a microscale level, together with mass transfer and electrochemical reactions inside the electrodes, providing a novel approach to predict SOFC performance numerically.
Titulo: Microscale Correlations Adoption in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Based on the physical connections and interactions of microstructure parameters, two submodel correlations (i.e., porosity-tortuosity and porosity-particle size ratio) are proposed.
Titulo: Microscale Correlations Adoption in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Three experiments from literature are selected to facilitate the validation of the numerical results with experimental data.
Titulo: Microscale Correlations Adoption in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: In addition, a sensitivity analysis is performed to investigate the impact of the adopted submodel correlations to the SOFC performance predictions.
Titulo: Microscale Correlations Adoption in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Normally, the microstructural inputs in the numerical model need to be measured by experiments in order to test the real cell performance.
Titulo: Microscale Correlations Adoption in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: By adopting the two submodel correlations, the simulation can be performed without obtaining relatively hard-to-measure microstructural parameters such as tortuosity and particle size, yet still accurately mimicking a real-world well-structured SOFC operation.
Titulo: Microscale Correlations Adoption in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: By accurately and rationally predicting the microstructural parameters, this study can eventually help to aid the experimental and optimization study of SOFC.
Titulo: Microscale Correlations Adoption in Solid Oxide Fuel Cell
